result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Getsinger states she now has a conflict of interest on the newest complaint - new PD will be appointed.  Requests resets in all matters for new ARGN.  Bonds continued.
Arraignment scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:08 PM Defendant Dylan P. Wermuth in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Dylan P. Wermuth.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Getsinger advises of waiver today.  Defendant agrees and understands the waiver of preliminary hearing today.  Attorney Getsigner is satisfied the defendant understands.  It is freely and knowing.  State agrees.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Request arraignment date.  Other matters pending.  Request 9/23/2022 as new date.  Request all matters track.  22cf462 & 22cf463.  Court will reset all matters to 09/23/2022.  Return for CF462 & CF463 for return and arrg. for CF162.
Arraignment scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on September 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dylan P. Wermuth in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Dylan P. Wermuth.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Getsinger states she was just appointed on Monday of this week and has not had good contact w/the DE but that has been rectified.  Requests the PH be reset to the next round of intake for a likely waiver of prelim.  Court notes PH was set in May for July and then August and now they're being requested to set this over into September.  Court reviews her available dates/times.  PH reset.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Hayes makes record that DE wants new atty.  Court advises DE of right to atty.  DE understands.  Court grants withdraw and resets.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender appointment

Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date on May 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:40 PM Defendant Dylan P. Wermuth in court with attorney Kathryn E Hayes.  Defendant Dylan P. Wermuth in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dylan P. Wermuth appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE does qualify and Atty Hayes will be appointed.  State agrees to signature bond w/conditions.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  Not to possess any alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
